data.title: Failure to load some png images because of bug in libpng 1.6.32
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux x64
Godot 2.1.4-stable (libpng 1.6.32)

**Issue description:**
The following error is reported in console.
> ERROR: _png_error_function: IDAT: chunk data is too large
>    At: drivers/png/image_loader_png.cpp:61.
> libpng error: IDAT: chunk data is too large
> ERROR: _load_image: PNG Corrupted
>    At: drivers/png/image_loader_png.cpp:93.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Include the following image in a scene:
[ChunkDataTooLarge.png.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1266887/ChunkDataTooLarge.png.zip)

Link to upstream bug: https://sourceforge.net/p/libpng/bugs/270/

data.title: Instance properties not showing up in debugging area
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux 64bit - debian stable
Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
Trying to debug with the remote inspector, the properties of the node are not been shown in the properties area of the debugger. Although a snapshot of the properties are shown in the inspector area of the editor.

This is a severe problem, because debugging with the built-in debugger is not possible anymore.

Expected: Properties showing up in the debugger area, not in the editor area, like in 2.1.3.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Only in version 2.1.4, with old projects, demo projects and new projects...

**Link to minimal example project:**
just take any project of the demo container

data.title: Custom font is not applied to TreeItem
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10, 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
TreeItem node of editable mode does not view the text by custom (dynamic or bitmap) font but default font until return key is pressed.
This is critical when the input text is non-Latin characters, since that isn't displayed till you push enter.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run and input in the tree.
Press return key then the font changes.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[treefont_issue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1266358/treefont_issue.zip)

data.title: LINK/UNLINK console spam with navmeshes
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
When I have navmeshes in my scene, the console log gets full of LINK or UNLINK lines. Made worse by the fact that I use groups to toggle some of them on/off.

Those should be removed or at the very least tell me which navmesh (instance/polygon) they mean. Preferably removed (and optionally toggled on by visible navigation debug option, if they are expanded to actually mean something)


**Steps to reproduce:**
Slap a navmesh into your scene, run.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Add a check to see if the current platform should use imported paths.
data.body:
Need to implement this on other platforms than iPhone if it is required.

There is the question of whether or not this is the intended behavior in the first place?

data.title: Nodes added via EditorPlugin should have more direct file path access
data.body:
It seems to make more sense for nodes that are added as a new node type to have an easier way of retrieving their script resource.

Currently, if I had a node at `res://addons/my_plugin/path/to/my/node.gd`, I have to actually supply the entire path to the node in the plugin just to extend its functionality with a script (seems pretty extreme). I'm not sure how possible it would be to get syntax highlighting / compilation off of the node's name in GDScript (does adding it to the ClassDB allow for that at all?). However, even if that weren't possible, there's gotta be something we can do. Even if it's just adding a Globals method (or adding a class to the Globals) that takes a string and returns the corresponding path to the script file. Something like...?

    # Given a 'MyNode' new node type
    extends script("MyNode")
    var MyNode = preload(script("MyNode"))

data.title: Nodes added via EditorPlugin shouldn't have properties under Script Variables
data.body:
If a node's script is added to the engine via `EditorPlugin::add_custom_type`, the exported properties of that node should not be listed in the Inspector under Script Variables. Instead, it should be labeled whatever the name of the new node type is. For example, with a new node called MyNode inheriting Control, I might have in the Inspector...

    MyNode
    * My Var
    Control
    * etc.

Then, if I add a script to that node, I should see...

    Script Variables
    * A Script Var
    MyNode
    * My Var
    Control
    * etc.

data.title: Change Type of add_custom_type'd node does not change icon
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0, Windows x64

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I used an EditorPlugin to add a custom type. When attempting to use the Change Type option in the context menu when right-clicking on the node in the hierarchy, the icon to the left of the node did not update to reflect the change.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. add a new type.
2. create a node of that type.
3. use the Change Type option in the node's context menu to switch to a different node type.

The icon will not update itself.

The red errors is full my console. I don't really  know why I cause them from the scripts.

The editor complain with my script as following code
```
if a != null:
```
I don't think this way to check an instance is null has any problem.

Maybe we should remove this from here?

data.title: Improved New Project and Import project experience
data.body:
Hopefully this will be a better and simpler users.

**edit**: i made some improvements

now you dont have the set default folder in the dialog, maybe it would be better to add a button to open the editor settings from the manager.

you can create a project folder right from the dialog
![screenshot from 2017-09-23 22-43-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30779275-f27fdd1a-a0b1-11e7-8153-90401c95b758.png)

also the non error messages are hidden by default, the warnings can be viewed by pressing the status icon.
![screenshot from 2017-09-23 22-44-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30779276-0c5faa94-a0b2-11e7-992f-0f9258e6c7e0.png)

![screenshot from 2017-09-23 22-44-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30779278-15ab8b54-a0b2-11e7-9e84-ebb2f4642ba8.png)

if you cancel the creation, or change the path the manager will get rid of the created folder, so you can create a new one.

and this is how the errors look.

data.title: SSL Failure on 2.1.4
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10, Ubuntu Linux 16.04, Godot Engine 2.1.4 Stable

**Issue description:**
SSL fails to connect.  Also gives a really weirdly spaced error message in console, noted below.

```
Cause: unable to get local issuer certificate
CERT STR: /C=GB/ST=Greater Manchester/L=Salford/O=COMODO CA Limited/CN=COMODO RSA Certification Authority
VALID: 0
CONNECTION RESULT: -1
8028:error:14090086:SSL routines:ssl3_get_server_certificate:certificate verify failed:thirdparty\openssl\ssl\s3_clnt.c:1269:
E R R O R :   S t r e a m P e e r O p e n S S L : : _ p r i n t _ e r r o r :   S o m e   I / O   e r r o r   o c c u r r e d .   T h e   O p e n S S L   e r r o r   q u e u e   m a y   c o n t a i n   m o r e   i n f o r m a t i o n   o n   t h e   e r r o r .
       A t :   m o d u l e s \ o p e n s s l \ s t r e a m _ p e e r _ o p e n s s l . c p p : 4 1 5
 [ 2 0 1 7 - 0 8 - 3 0   2 0 : 0 2 : 1 6 . 0 2 9 ]   D E B U G :   P O S T   r e q u e s t   s e n d i n g   d a t a
 E R R O R :   S t r e a m P e e r O p e n S S L : : _ p r i n t _ e r r o r :   A   f a i l u r e   i n   t h e   S S L   l i b r a r y   o c c u r r e d ,   u s u a l l y   a   p r o t o c o l   e r r o r .
       A t :   m o d u l e s \ o p e n s s l \ s t r e a m _ p e e r _ o p e n s s l . c p p : 4 1 8
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to connect via HTTP.connect with SSL enabled and certificate added in settings.  Above response is given in console and the function fails to connect.

Have tested it in 2.1.3 and it works fine, as normal, but fails in 2.1.4.  Think it's broken.

data.title: Can't see certain controls on HiDPI Editor
data.body: **Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):** MacOS Sierra Godot 2.1.4 Macbook Pro 2015 13" **Issue description:** I wanted to edit a global script for my project, but since I'm using a retina screen and a HiDPI config, the options seem to be broken: Also happens with SamplePlayer2D: As a temporary fix I can set the Editor DPI to LoDPI, but the font is so small it's unusable so I have to go back to HiDPI after the setting is done. **Steps to reproduce:** Configure HiDPI Editor: add a global script. Add a sound to a soundbank2d **Link to minimal example project:**

data.title: Fix pre-Lollipop Android debug
data.body:
Namely, automatically pick debug over Wi-Fi for devices with an older release and debug over USB otherwise.

A message is printed both in editor output window and console (uppercase here) to let the user know about what mechanism is being used and why.

data.title: Fix pre-Lollipop Android debug (2.1)
data.body:
Namely, automatically pick debug over Wi-Fi for devices with an older release and debug over USB otherwise.

A message is printed both in editor output window and console (uppercase here) to let the user know about what mechanism is being used and why.

Fixes #10458.

data.title: second attempt on fixing the indent glitch.
data.body:
I've reverted the first attempt (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/10653).
I was very naive and didn't consider that the glitch happens also if you're not in the first column, ex. if you have 2 tabs and press return in between them.
Hope this will solve the problem without messing anything else.

data.title: Mono Ogg files played incorrectly in 3D
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 x64
Godot 3.0 (8b9026c05e9982a7bc0c7f52776ad74276b90252)

**Issue description:**
AudioStreamPlayer3D plays mono Ogg files as if they have only left channel (sound only comes out from left speaker).
Sample Ogg file: [sample_mono.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1263464/sample_mono.zip)

Stereo Ogg file are played correctly as well as WAV files.

data.title: Fix a crash when an early dialog tries to appear
data.body:
This changes the order of creating some of the dialogs that may appear
during project import/startup. It is possible for the 'accept' dialog to
be required before it is initialized.

This moves all of these dialogs to earlier in the constructor so this
can't happen.

Backtrace of the crash:
```
Thread 1 "godot.x11.tools" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000e9ae6e in AcceptDialog::get_ok (this=0x0)
    at ./scene/gui/dialogs.h:137
137		Button *get_ok() { return ok; }
(gdb) bt
#0  0x0000000000e9ae6e in AcceptDialog::get_ok (this=0x0)
    at ./scene/gui/dialogs.h:137
#1  0x00000000011cc777 in EditorNode::_menu_option_confirm (this=0x4d2b760, 
    p_option=52, p_confirmed=false) at editor/editor_node.cpp:2234
#2  0x00000000011bde6f in EditorNode::_menu_option (this=0x4d2b760, 
    p_option=52) at editor/editor_node.cpp:554
#3  0x00000000011e989e in EditorNode::EditorNode (this=0x4d2b760)
    at editor/editor_node.cpp:5002
#4  0x0000000000d3d3db in Main::start () at main/main.cpp:1249
#5  0x0000000000d138a6 in main (argc=2, argv=0x7fffffffdfd8)
    at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:53
(gdb) 
```

reported on IRC

data.title: Duplicated 'has_method' method on ScriptLanguage (c812c17)
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot Master branch

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Error occurs: `bind_methodfi: Class Script already has a method has_method`

`has_method` is of `Object` class.

Regression since c812c17

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c812c176330bfc53a780c0a7c8a9091ddb90f352/core/script_language.cpp#L58

data.title: HDR Auto exposure
data.body: Now that "Update Always" option is deprecated, HDR Auto exposure needs this option to operate smoothly in the editor. So now it's a bug.

data.title: RigidBody2D strange behavior when working with _integrate_forces
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot v3.0.alpha.custom_build.3ae1cff

I try applying a force to the rigid body based on the position of another node, but only if the distance between them is above a certain value. The other node is tied to the mouse position.

If I move the node quickly (immediately after the game starts) then the rigid body moves as expected (the if statement passes and all is right).

If I wait a bit (> 1 sec) before I move the other node with the mouse, rigid body doesn't do anything, it's like the `if` statement inside the `_integrate_foces` breaks stuff. Tried without `if` and works as expected.

Check project.
[godot-dbg.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1263321/godot-dbg.zip)

data.title: Remove 10778 related methods from GDNative
data.body:
After #10778 master didn't build any longer with GDNative. This removes
the methods removed in that PR from the GDNative bindings for Basis
also.

data.title: Move everything from .godot/config into corresponding project folders like .tmp
data.body:
today i was tinkering with shaders and again made editor crash (i have no source because editor crashed and code was not saved). but after i've tried loading the project again, it crashed on splash again.
i tried reviewing what i had in project folder, even deleted the tscn file. but i was only able to load, after i've deleted `project_metadata.cfg` that i've found using process monitor application.

but if all this stuff was in project_filder/.tmp i could just delete that folder and proceed with the work.
why keep development data outside the project folder anyway?

UPD: in project_metadata.cfg there was only one setting - update_always=true. so this is just a part of my problem, bugged shader is still somewhere, but is not touched by the editor upon loading

data.title: glTF import crashes when importing models with cameras
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
OS: Arch Linux 64 bit
Git hash: 8337d272ba36044cc9e1a9273b01418a0120be9b

**Issue description:**
Importing the Duck sample from Khronos's glTF 2.0 samples (https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/blob/master/2.0/Duck/glTF-Embedded/Duck.gltf) crashes Godot when importing. A backtrace (below) points to camera parsing. Editing the file to remove the camera works around the crash.

```
#0  0x00007f571eb978c0 in raise () from /usr/lib/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007f571eb98f72 in abort () from /usr/lib/libc.so.6
#2  0x00007f571ebd6be2 in __libc_message () from /usr/lib/libc.so.6
#3  0x00007f571ec63158 in __fortify_fail () from /usr/lib/libc.so.6
#4  0x00007f571ec63120 in __stack_chk_fail_local () from /usr/lib/libc.so.6
#5  0x0000555555de11de in EditorSceneImporterGLTF::_parse_cameras (this=<optimized out>, state=...) at editor/import/editor_scene_importer_gltf.cpp:1436
#6  0x0000555555de74ef in EditorSceneImporterGLTF::import_scene (this=0x55555afac980, p_path=..., p_flags=<optimized out>, p_bake_fps=15, r_missing_deps=<optimized out>, r_err=<optimized out>) at editor/import/editor_scene_importer_gltf.cpp:2085
#7  0x0000555555e00b16 in ResourceImporterScene::import (this=<optimized out>, p_source_file=..., p_save_path=..., p_options=..., r_platform_variants=<optimized out>, r_gen_files=<optimized out>) at editor/import/resource_importer_scene.cpp:1019
#8  0x0000555555bf7498 in EditorFileSystem::_reimport_file (this=<optimized out>, p_file=...) at editor/editor_file_system.cpp:1403
#9  0x0000555555bede48 in EditorFileSystem::reimport_files (this=0x55555afaccc0, p_files=...) at editor/editor_file_system.cpp:1504
#10 0x0000555555bece04 in EditorFileSystem::_update_scan_actions (this=<optimized out>) at editor/editor_file_system.cpp:393
#11 0x0000555555bf31cd in EditorFileSystem::_notification (this=0x55555afaccc0, p_what=<optimized out>) at editor/editor_file_system.cpp:1017
#12 0x0000555555bfce27 in EditorFileSystem::_notificationv (this=0x55555afaccc0, p_notification=17, p_reversed=<error reading variable: access outside bounds of object referenced via synthetic pointer>) at ./editor/editor_file_system.h:100
#13 0x0000555556d45801 in Object::notification (this=0x55555afaccc0, p_notification=17, p_reversed=<optimized out>) at core/object.cpp:849
#14 0x00005555562ea3a9 in SceneTree::_notify_group_pause (this=0x555559802f50, p_group=..., p_notification=17) at scene/main/scene_tree.cpp:908
#15 0x00005555562ea90b in SceneTree::idle (this=<optimized out>, p_time=<optimized out>) at scene/main/scene_tree.cpp:488
#16 0x00005555556fccf8 in Main::iteration () at main/main.cpp:1572
#17 0x00005555556e5062 in OS_X11::run (this=0x7fffffffe0b8) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:2109
#18 0x00005555556dd1d0 in main (argc=4, argv=0x7fffffffe5c8) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:54
```


**Steps to reproduce:**
Attempt to import [this](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/blob/master/2.0/Duck/glTF-Embedded/Duck.gltf) glTF file.
